text: Richard Salisbury Williamson (May 9, 1949 â€“ December 8, 2013) was an American lawyer, diplomat and pedagogue. He previously served as Special Envoy to Sudan under George W. Bush. Williamson was a partner at Winston & Strawn and was also Thomas J. Sharkey Distinguished Visiting Scholar at Seton Hall's Whitehead School of Diplomacy. Williamson died of a cerebral hemorrhage at a Chicago hospital on December 8, 2013, aged 64. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2013 deaths Category:Deaths from cerebral hemorrhage Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:American diplomats Category:Writers from Chicago Category:Writers from Virginia Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:Politicians from Virginia Category:Lawyers from Virginia Category:Lawyers from Chicago Category:Lawyers from Evanston, Illinois Category:Politicians from Evanston, Illinois Category:Writers from Evanston, Illinois
title: Richard S. Williamson
